channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Petkit Purobot Ultra Review: Taking Litter Boxes to the Next Level
item.description: The world's first AI-powered automatic litter box dares to ask the question: What does it look like inside the box when my cat poops?

item.title: GitHub launches a free version of its Copilot
item.description: Microsoft-owned GitHub today announced a free version of its popular Copilot code completion/AI pair programming tool, which will also now ship by def...

item.title: Botto, the Millionaire AI Artist, Is Getting a Personality
item.description: Botto is a 'decentralized AI artist' whose work has fetched millions. As AI improves, its creators may give it fewer guardrails to test its emerging p...

item.title: Wing and DoorDash launch drone deliveries in Dallas-Fort Worth
item.description: Alphabet’s Wing announced on Wednesday that it’s expanding its partnership with DoorDash to bring drone delivery to customers in the the Dallas-Fort W...

item.title: CDC Confirms First US Case of Severe Bird Flu
item.description: This is the first case of H5N1 in the US this year that has sent a patient to the hospital.

item.title: OpenAI brings ChatGPT to your landline
item.description: ChatGPT is coming to phones. No, not smartphones — landlines. Call 1-800-242-8478 (1-800-CHATGPT), and OpenAI’s AI-powered assistant will respond as o...

item.title: Who wants ‘Her’-like AI that gets stuff wrong?
item.description: Hiya, folks, welcome to TechCrunch’s regular AI newsletter. If you want this in your inbox every Wednesday, smash the link and sign up here. Last week...

item.title: Microsoft bought nearly 500,000 Nvidia Hopper chips this year
item.description: Microsoft bought more than twice as many Nvidia Hopper chips this year than any of its biggest rivals. The tech giant bought 485,000 Nvidia Hopper chi...

item.title: 15 Best Stocking Stuffers (2024), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Start Christmas morning off on the right foot with these excellent, tiny gifts.

item.title: Your Fancy Wine Could Well Be Fake. Some Are Hoping to Sniff Out a Solution
item.description: One fifth of all wine sold worldwide could be fake. Now tech similar to MRI scans and gas-smelling, aroma-analyzing equipment might yield the answer.
